Text.Value: I don't know. I don't know! Pass, then - and do NOT come BACK. This is Sarin's final resting place - and a killing ground for all who come to disturb her.
Pay your respects as you pass, then - and do NOT come BACK.
NO! Enough of the gods and their meddling - she will be PURE!
And now you come to interrupt the funeral rites? I -
Sarin, Bareki, and I - we were the three finest thieves in Baldur's Gate. We broke into the offices of Gortash. Discovered he was with the Absolute too.
Attack.
You have it wrong. I'm not with the Absolute!
Sarin is... silent, now. I think. At rest.
And 'Cousin' looks like he fell out of an aboleth's arse. Are you sure you're related?
...Good. That is good. She deserves... more than me.
Pass, then - and do NOT come BACK. This is Sarin's final resting place - and a killing ground for all who come to disturb her.
...You're right. It must be a cleansing fire. A pure one. I took Sarin's life - I must be sure she does not lose her soul, as well.
Hah. I believe you may believe that. The Absolute takes people, twists them...
Yes, Cousin. An excellent idea.
What's this, Cousin? Another Absolutist come to see what we did to poor old Sarin?
I haven't got the slightest idea who or what you're talking about.
Perhaps Bareki will find me again. His jokes were much better than Cousin's.
Of course you don't. Sarin, Bareki, and I made our coin by going unnoticed. The finest thieves in the city - until we messed with Gortash and he sent the cult after us.
My people know this rite - Ixinloex, the 'Burning of the Dead'. There can be no bloodshed here.
She swore she was no cultist, but you all lie - the Absolute turns you...
You need witnesses - I'm a witness. Just here to pay my respects.
Cousin says we will take you in return. He says you look just like kindling for Sarin's funeral pyre.
I'm not a cultist. And I don't think your friend was, either. Your paranoia turned you against one another.
Leaving only me to conduct Sarin's rites. And my cousins, here - you cannot conduct the rites without a clan to bear witness. Or some fuel for the fire.
Your paranoia already killed Sarin. Are you so keen to follow her?
He is... clan. Summoned in place of the friends that I lost.
Wait. No need for violence. Just tell me what happened to your friend.
Go on, then. Let's find out whose flame is bigger.
Your god took her mind, cultist. So Bareki took her head, and I burned the flesh from her bones.
...Yes. YES!
Your fellow cultists hunted us so we hid down here. We were safe - and so was our loot - until the darkness soured Sarin's mind. She kept our treasure from us, said Bareki and I had gone strange.
Say your words as you pass, then, priest. And do NOT come BACK.
I'm sworn to a better god than the Absolute. Why not let me say a prayer?
I... cannot. I am the last of us left to do the rites. I must do the rites.
Mephits and grease. Press me, and you might see some real magic.
You serve the guildmaster...? Then you cannot be with the cult. Or... perhaps she is.
This is Sarin's final resting place - and a killing ground for all who come to disturb her.
If you're a thief, then you answer to Nine-Fingers. We're allies.
HUSH, COUSIN! Sarin turned into a cultist herself. So we did what we had to. Bareki wept until his voice was gone - and then he was gone, too.
I took my friend's life - but only after your god took her soul.
NO NO NO! You are so deep in the Absolute's power, you do not even know it yourself. Just like Sarin!

Synopsis: The Fire Wizard interrupts the combat to shout crazy profanities at you. You can take the opportunity to convince him to stop fighting, or you can continue to fight.
